node.title: ASB half-year cash profit increases 22 percent, reaching $742m
node.description: ASB has had a strong lift in profit on the back of increased lending, higher margins, and lower bad debts.

node.title: Marlborough's landfill accounts for three quarters of council's emissions
node.description: The biggest contributor to carbon emissions in Marlborough is its landfill site, with more than 34,000 tonnes emitted in 2020.

node.title: Bill to ban conversion therapy passes second reading
node.description: A bill that would ban conversion therapy has passed its second reading in Parliament.

node.title: Chloe Kim qualifies to defend her gold.
node.description: The defending gold medalist easily qualified for Thursday’s 12-women finals.

node.title: Shaun White will compete in his last Olympics
node.description: Wednesday’s halfpipe qualifier will be his last Olympic event.

node.title: NBC lingered on Shiffrin after her fall, drawing anger.
node.description: Many compared the moment to the treatment of Simone Biles, who tweeted in support of Shiffrin.

node.title: Jane Campion's 'The Power of the Dog' leads Oscar race
node.description: New Zealand director Jane Campion's film The Power of the Dog leads the nominations for this year's Oscars. Video

node.title: Covid-19 update: 204 new community cases in NZ today
node.description: There are 204 new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today, the Ministry of Health has reported.

node.title: Oprah announces new book club selection
node.description: "The Way of Integrity: Finding The Path To Your True Self" is the 94th Oprah's Book Club pick.

node.title: Mikaela Shiffrin out early in second race in a row
node.description: Shiffrin also crashed out early in her first event, the giant slalom.

node.title: Mikaela Shiffrin, still without a medal, is disqualified from her best event.
node.description: Shiffrin, a two time Olympic champion, was disqualifeid after h

node.title: 'Gross breach of trust': Melbourne man spared jail time over explicit photo blackmail
node.description: Martin Nguyen, who admitted threatening to send explicit photos and videos of his ex-girlfriend to her parents, was sentenced to an 18-month community corrections order.

node.title: Former owner of Australia's largest dairy farm fails in bid to sue new owner
node.description: The New Zealand-owned Tasmanian Land Company argued Van Dairy breached an agreement reached in 2016 over the sale of Australia's largest dairy farm.

node.title: Maryland Supreme Court hears case from D.C. sniper seeking new sentence
node.description: Lee Boyd Malvo's lawyer argued his sentences should be reconsidered because of a 2012 U.S. Supreme Court decision barring mandatory life sentences for juveniles.

node.title: Ōamaru's blue penguins combine tourism, conservation and science
node.description: A colony of little blue penguins in North Otago's Ōamaru has gone from being a nuisance to the stars of a show that supports not only their own conservation, but helps to protect their species. Video

node.title: The United States has not yet won any gold medals in Beijing.
node.description: This is the third time the Americans have reached the fifth day of a Games without having attained the top honor in any event.

node.title: Matatū unveils inaugural jersey
node.description: The Super Rugby Aupiki side Matatū has unveiled its inaugural jersey.

node.title: Former "American Idol" contestant Caleb Kennedy charged with DUI in fatal crash
node.description: Kennedy allegedly drove a 2011 Ford pickup truck into a workshop behind a home, fatally injuring the person inside.

node.title: West Coast forecast to get more heavy rain, orange warning issued
node.description: MetService has upgraded its heavy rain watch for Buller and Westland to an orange warning.

node.title: Tight hiring market could affect tax season as IRS looks for help
node.description: The agency's Taxpayer Advocate said to avoid delays, people should triple-check for errors, file electronically and use direct deposit for refunds.

node.title: Cleaning business' graphic photos posted online being looked into as 'potential privacy breach'
node.description: The Acting Privacy Commissioner is shocked and appalled by the graphic images posted by a trauma cleaning company and wants to hear from anyone who thinks the company has breached their privacy. Audio

node.title: Journalist George Packer says thousands of at-risk Afghans left behind still need U.S. help
node.description: Now private citizens have taken the matter into their own hands by paying for private charter flights to get these Afghans out of danger, Packer told CBS News Live.

node.title: Donovan Carrillo is first Mexican to compete in free skate at the Olympics
node.description: The 22-year-old athlete is also the first Mexican figure skater in history to advance to the free skate.

node.title: Neil Young takes aim at Spotify CEO, big banks
node.description: Neil Young has asked employees of Spotify to quit their jobs while urging people to withdraw their money from big American banks, in protests over coronavirus misinformation and climate change.

node.title: $1m donation for planned mental health facility for young people
node.description: A charity raising funds for a new mental health outpatient unit for Canterbury children and teenagers has been given $1 million by the New Zealand Community Trust.

node.title: Overseas interest in Youth Hotel Association accomodation
node.description: There is overseas interest for the nine Youth Hostel Association hostels that are being sold following their closure.

node.title: Biathlete keen for more Olympic racing after satisfying start
node.description: Biathlon skier Campbell Wright delivered one of the best performances of his career in his Olympic debut in the Men's 20km Individual race.

node.title: Oncology nurse forms bond with patients after her own cancer diagnosis
node.description: "Every time a patient would find out, they would look at me like they were seeing me for the first time. And then we could have a more intimate conversation about treatment, side effects," she said.

node.title: Covid-19: Countdown cans restrictions on goods for now
node.description: There seems to be different approaches taken by supermarkets over limited sales of some products, with Countdown not having any in place on products apart from Panadol and Ibuprofen. Audio

node.title: House passes bill to fund government through early March
node.description: Government funding will run out on February 18, unless a bill to fund the government is passed by Congress and signed by President Biden.
